definition: to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in

sentences.english: “The Land Down Under” is Australia’s unofficial nickname.
sentences.chinese: “腳下那邊的土地”是人們對澳大利亞的別稱。

sentences.english: But its nickname is the Centennial State .
Expert systems are another name for Classical AI.
sentences.chinese: 專家系統是古典人工智能的別稱。

sentences.english: Dixie itself is a nickname for the American South.
sentences.chinese: 狄克西本身是美國南部的別稱。

sentences.english: They are other names for what most of us call the ladybug .
sentences.chinese: 這些是我們大部分人叫做瓢蟲的東西的別稱。

sentences.english: There is a reason it’s nicknamed “the Crackberry.”
sentences.chinese: 它被別稱爲“可卡因莓”是有原因的。

sentences.english: Delaware, the Diamond or First State, achieved statehood.
sentences.chinese: 別稱“鑽石州”或“第一州”的美國特拉華建州。

sentences.english: Actual the another namer that is operation and development.
sentences.chinese: 實際就是運營和開發的別稱吧。
三亞市也因此別稱“鹿城”。

sentences.english: So another nickname is City of Flowers and Sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 由此，它另一個別稱叫做“鮮花陽光城”。

sentences.english: Buddhistsadopted the termas an epithet for the Buddha and his arahant disciples.
sentences.chinese: 佛教常以此作爲佛陀和他的阿羅漢弟子的一個別稱。

sentences.english: Sichuanalso has a nickname, Land of Abundance.
sentences.chinese: 四川還有一個別稱，天府之國。

sentences.english: Which commercial complex is also known as the "book city"?
sentences.chinese: “書城”是新加坡哪一個商業中心的別稱？

sentences.english: Call me Tom, don't surname me.
sentences.chinese: 別稱呼我的姓，叫我湯姆就行了。

sentences.english: Guangzhou has other beautiful nicknames such as " Flower city" and " The Goat City".
sentences.chinese: 廣州有美麗的別稱，如“花城”和“山市”。

sentences.english: Guangzhou is a beautiful city. Flower City is the other name.
sentences.chinese: 廣州是一座美麗的城市，別稱花城。

definition: scientific name/Latin name (of plant or animal)/(according to an old system of nomenclature) on entering school life, a formal personal name given to new students
called/to call sth (by a name)/to name
to be collectively called/collective term/general designation
to be generally referred to (as)/generic term
person (first person, second person etc in grammar)/called/known as
pronunciation/literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
